title: Add New Child
content:
Finding the Form     There are three ways to get to the new child form in OpenEMR:
 The “Search or Add Child” tab is open by default, just click on the Tab Title. On the Children List tab (the default tab) you can click the “Add Child” button. You can also hover over the “Child” menu option and click “New/Search”.  Search or Add Child     The only optional field on the form is Sex, which can be left Unassigned. All other fields are required.
Once all data is entered, click the “Save New Child” button.
Possible Duplicates     OpenEMR automatically checks for duplicate patients. A popup is shown.
No Duplicates     If there are no possible duplicates, click on “Confirm New Patient”
Possible Duplicates     If there are possible duplicates, they will be listed in the popup. Clicking on the row will take you to the suggested patient. Clicking “Confirm New Patient” will create the patient, ignoring the alert.

title: Allergy Management
content:
Allergy management is one of the core functionalities of the Azul Wasi OpenEMR installation.
Viewing Allergies     Allergy information can be viewed from the Medical Records Dashboard. See Medical Record Dashboard Overviewfor more information. Once on the Medical Records Dashboard, Allergies are listed on the right column.
Add a New Allergy       From the Allergy Card found on the Medical Record Dashboard, click on the “Edit” button on the top of the Card. This launches the Medical Issues page.   Click the “Add” button next to the Allergies title.   The Allergy Popup is displayed. The only required information is the Title field, although it is highly recommended to also fill out the Severity field and Reaction fields. You can click the name of common allergies from the Quick Pick List or type your own in the title field.
  Once the information is entered, click “Save”
